unnormalised: RBI just announced some changes affecting how we handle cash withdrawals, folks! Starting 01/01/2025, daily ATM withdrawal limits for non-KYC accounts are capped at ₹10,000. So, if you haven't submitted your Aadhaar number yet, best to do it pronto!
normalised: R-B-I just announced some changes affecting how we handle cash withdrawals, folks! Starting first january two thousand and twenty five, daily A-T-M withdrawal limits for non K-Y-C accounts are capped at rupee ten thousand. So, if you haven't submitted your Aadhaar number yet, best to do it pronto!

unnormalised: This move is aimed at curbing fraud and promoting digital transactions, according to the RBI circular. The new rule impacts ATMs across all banks, including SBI, HDFC, and ICICI. Don’t say we didn’t warn you!
normalised: This move is aimed at curbing fraud and promoting digital transactions, according to the R-B-I circular. The new rule impacts A-T-Ms across all banks, including S-B-I, H-D-F-C, and I-C-I-C-I. Don’t say we didn’t warn you!

unnormalised: For KYC-compliant accounts, the existing withdrawal limit of ₹25,000 per day remains unchanged. But remember, that's only if you have your KYC details updated. The RBI press release cited a 25% increase in ATM related frauds in the last FY.
normalised: For K-Y-C-compliant accounts, the existing withdrawal limit of rupee twenty five thousand per day remains unchanged. But remember, that's only if you have your K-Y-C details updated. The R-B-I press release cited a twenty five percent increase in A-T-M related frauds in the last F-Y.

unnormalised: And here’s a little tip: for transactions over ₹50,000 at bank branches, you'll need to provide your PAN card from 15/11/2024. So, keep that handy! These changes are effective nationwide.
normalised: And here’s a little tip: for transactions over rupee fifty thousand at bank branches, you'll need to provide your P-A-N card from fifteenth november two thousand and twenty four. So, keep that handy! These changes are effective nationwide.

unnormalised: Also, watch out for sneaky UPI charges. While UPI transactions are generally free, some private banks are rumoured to start levying a small fee (around ₹5) for transactions exceeding ₹2,000 after 15/12/2024. It's still unconfirmed, but stay alert!
normalised: Also, watch out for sneaky U-P-I charges. While U-P-I transactions are generally free, some private banks are rumoured to start levying a small fee (around rupee five) for transactions exceeding rupee two thousand after fifteenth december two thousand and twenty four. It's still unconfirmed, but stay alert!

unnormalised: The finance ministry claims that these measures will help boost digital payments by 30% in the next quarter, but only time will tell. Meanwhile, your neighborhood kirana store is still happily accepting ₹10 notes.
normalised: The finance ministry claims that these measures will help boost digital payments by thirty percent in the next quarter, but only time will tell. Meanwhile, your neighborhood kirana store is still happily accepting rupee ten notes.
